sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with no solutions.
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations: 

    2x - 3y = 7 
    4x - 6y = 14 

and state whether the system has any solutions or not.
message_2:
First, we can notice that the second equation is just a multiple of the first equation. If we multiply the first equation by 2, we get:

    4x - 6y = 14

This is the same as the second equation. Since both equations represent the same line, the system has infinitely many solutions. The two lines are identical, so every point on the line is a solution to the system.
